file_content.text: Did I ever mention I have a fear of being poisoned to death?
Quesh is a critical planet in the war, my lord. I'm glad we're here to add our weight to the effort.
From the sky to the soil, the blight of war marks this world.
The embers of war are smoldering here. We will leave this world engulfed in flames!
The Empire is thirsty to take Quesh. What say we quench that thirst.
Our eyes water! Our lungs burn! Our heart quickens for war!
The skies bleed, the air is sweet.
And I thought Hutta smelled bad. I guess it's true there's no good thing the Hutts can't spoil.
I've never seen such a disgusting place. Was it always like this, or have we made it that way with all our mining and industry?
Industry has a rather distinct odor, doesn't it? I might advise breathing through the mouth.
Industrial landscape. Many ways to kill. Thick, dusty air makes good cover. Smell overpowering, have to rely on other senses.
I can see why no one's heard of this place. Think my eyes are burning.
We've never seen a sky so red before--not even under a red star. It must be the atmosphere.
I've heard rumors about Quesh, but very few details. I'd very much like to tour the venom mines.
This place makes Hutta look like a breath of fresh air... smells like I just put out a death stick with my nose.
Nothing like a breath of fresh toxins to really get you going in the morning.
Stinks worse than rakghouls. Gonna be nose deaf for a week.
Umm, Blizz feel kind of dizzy. Maybe sit down. Please?
Ahh. Smells like burnin' spice and blood. Gonna like it here.
Quesh = hostile to organics // Droids = not much better off
The Republic wouldn't normally bother with a planet this disgusting, but we need Quesh's resources. We can't let the Empire have them.
Those inoculations we got better work. Ol' Doc isn't dying on a planet this ugly.
Hmm. Sky color reminds of blood.
Quesh is living proof of that age-old edict: Big money always smells bad.
I remember this smell. From bioweapon attacks. Why are we here again?
A whole world living on poison. There's a metaphor in there somewhere, I guess.
Are you really sure it's safe to breathe here? I think my hair's starting to curl.
This is Quesh, huh? And I thought Nar Shaddaa was ugly....
Hutts ruin everything they touch. Quesh is no different.
Nobody mentioned Quesh was made of toxic mud. Should've worn my least-favorite boots.
The air on Quesh smells like death. This is no place for the weak.
You're sure we're immune to the atmosphere on Quesh? My gills are itching.
The faster we get our job done, the faster we can be off this rock. Let's move.
Even having taken precautions, we should attempt to limit our atmospheric exposure as much as possible.
Compensating sensors for atmospheric interference... complete! Ready to proceed!
Swampy, nasty and filled with poisonous gas--no wonder Hutts live here.
Admiration: There are few things I love more than a poisoned atmosphere. Liquidations become so much simpler.
Reassurance: Should your inoculation fail to protect you from the atmosphere, rest assured my deletions will continue in your name.
